newsitem.title: USA: Telxon CEO retires, COO takes over position.
newsitem.headline: Telxon CEO retires, COO takes over position.

text.p: Telxon Corp said Wednesday that Robert Meyerson has retired as chairman and chief executive officer after 25 years of service, and the company has elected current president and chief operating officer, Frank Brick, to succeed him as chief executive.
The company also said in a release it appointed Raj Reddy, an outside director of Telxon since 1987, non-executive chairman.

Brick joined Telxon in October 1993, and in February 1995, he was appointed president of Telxon's international division. In June 1996, Brick was promoted to president and chief operating officer of the parent corporation.
Telxon said Reddy is currently Dean of the School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University.
Meyerson said in the release that he will be available to Telxon "to advise on current and future customers, technology, marketing and investment opportunities."
